intro: Coeloglossum viride var. vaillantii, commonly known as the green hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright green, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its striking foliage and long-lasting blooms.
